item.title: abc.. to xyz
item.description:
abc.. to xyz

,

Creating your grid site may seem daunting at first, but believe us.. it’s not!

,

On this site, we’re collating all the information that we have learnt from creating many, many grid sites.. below you’ll find a simple video showing the very first stages of creating a site, but from there we can look at all other aspects.

,

Adding forms, videos, stores.. whatever you are looking for on your site, we can help get it set up..

,

..keep checking back for more articles and tips.. thanks!

,

*btw.. we’ll show you how to add the facebook comments box on our social media section.. slight change to the code facebook gives you, and we can have it working perfectly.. even on your visitors mobile phone..

,

item.title: setting up your 1st site..
item.description:
setting up your 1st site..

,,

* ..in the video section on this site, you can see how we embedded this video full width on both the home page, and also on it’s own page. It also means that the video will be available on the mobile version of your site with no issues…

item.title: new content added
item.description:
new content added

,

We have sub sites now to demonstrate various elements that can be useful on your grid site. From the menu top left, you can see we have now added ideas for forms, a store, and how to best add videos to your grid site.

,

But with any site, the best idea is to build up your site with content, and on the grid one of the under used methods we believe is the idea of sharing urls. It’s one of the options when you add more content.

,
“Content is king.” ~ Bill Gates
,

Simply paste the link to a site or an article where it says and press enter. Done. Molly will then visit the site and create an article. Over time she’ll have created a whole site for you.

,,

A good example of this is on the resources page of d-zign.us. All created by simply gathering links to useful sites or articles.

,
